Name: Dizzy Lizzy
Description:
A dice game combining strategy and luck in a race to the finish first!
—description from the publisher

Players take turns moving their pieces strategically to either land on beneficial spaces or to avoid potential hazards on a maze-like board in a race to see who can get to the finish line first.

—user summary

Name: El Fantasma
Description:
Each player must place letters on the board taking advantage of the prize boxes that will grant them credits (1, 2, or 3). The first player to get five credits is the winner. However, You can become a ghost and walk away from your goal or you can object to the last player's turn or call the word as completed - causing other players to lose credits or lives.

Avoid losing your three lives, because you will become the ghost.
Get five points to win the game.

Name: Hack!
Description:
In this game Hack!, 4 players try to hack each other's computers to steal private data and secrets, using some routers and USB cables. Each time one of them succeeds, he or she gets smarter and thus stronger. But be aware! When you get too smart, you'll surely meet more hurdles! The first player that manages to hack all computers wins the game.

Players layout a 6x6 grid of tiles face down and start the game with 5 tiles in their hand.  Players use or discard tiles from their hand to explore the boards and to turn, manipulate or block the route of networks as the board is developed.

Name: Squarin' Off
Description:
A game based off the old childhood game of Connect-the-Dots, but played with single, double and triple-point squares to enhance a level of strategy Complete as many squares as possible by filling in all four sides of a square with pegs while trying to give your opponents as few squares as possible. The player with the most points (not necessarily the most squares) wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine #7
Description:
Spellcaster: The Frostgrave Magazine exists to bring new rules, scenarios, and gaming ideas for players of Frostgrave and Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago.
This issue contains:

     The Diamonds of Elias Skull, a 3-scenario campaign for Ghost Archipelago.
     The Maze of Malcor Outtakes, including 1 scenario and 10 weird events.
     The Floating Hulk, a solo scenario for Ghost Archipelago.
     The Great Wyrm, a Frostgrave ‘big game’ campaign by Brent Sinclair, 3-scenarios leading to an encounter with a dragon!
     Rules for a new character, the Archer, in Barbarian Hack.
     Casting Roll Criticals in Frostgrave for Second Edition.
     16 Ulterior Motive Cards for Ghost Archipelago.


—description from the publisher

Name: Rome: Fall of the Empire
Description:
Reenact the fall of the Roman Empire in this grand campaign map. Hold the line as the Eastern or Western Roman Empire, supplant the empire with your kingdom as the tribal factions of the Sassanids, Franks and Goths, or trample all before you as the Huns. Each faction has unique victory conditions and ways to play. With numerous paths to victory, including variants, the game offers much replay-ability.

—description from the designer

Name: Newton & Great Discoveries
Description:
The 2nd Edition includes the Great Discoveries expansion and two promo cards (Stephen Hawking & Robert Hooke).

The middle of the 17th century was a period of great changes; with the advent of the scientific method came what we now call the Scientific Revolution. Many great scientists, with their theories and ideas, changed and shaped our perception of the universe: Galileo Galilei, Copernicus, Kepler, Bacon and, above all, Sir Isaac Newton.

In Newton, the players take the role of a young scientist who wants to become one of the great geniuses of this era. To reach their ultimate goal, they travel around Europe, visit universities and cities, study to discover new theories, build new tools and work to earn money.

The game is played over six rounds. Each round, every player plays five cards from their hand, and each played card allows the player to perform one of the many actions of the game. An action can have a variety of effects, which depend on the symbols on the board. At the end of the round, a player can take back all the cards except for one. One card has to remain on the board, which means that you give up one possibility of doing that action, but also that that very action will be carried out with greater strength. Fortunately, you can acquire new cards with additional powers to perform more actions.

After six rounds, you calculate your final score, and the player with the most VP wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gump: Pes, který naučil lidi žít
Description:
The family game Gump will tickle your cerebral threads and you will experience unforgettable adventures. During the game you are trying to make the dog Gump and and his human friend BedÅ™ich meet again on the same tile before you run out of playing cards. The game contains a large number of traps to stop you.

Players win if the two are reunited.


Rodinná hra Gump pÄ›knÄ› potrápí vaše mozkové závity a zaÅ¾ijete nezapomenutelná dobrodruÅ¾ství. PÅ™i hÅ™e se snaÅ¾íte, aby se psí kamarádi Gump a BedÅ™ich opÄ›t setkali. Hra obsahuje velké mnoÅ¾ství nástrah a úskalí, která budete muset pÅ™ekonat a bude jistÄ› bavit celou rodinu.

Name: Wipe Out
Description:
Can you draw a picture of. Scarecrow riding a horse in the jungle? Or a cowboy picking flowers on a pirate ship?

Put your artistic talents to the test with this crazy drawing game! Players battle it out to draw funny scenes based on topic cards for their team to guess.  Will you be able to guess the right answer or will you be a doodle dropout?

The team that guesses the most answers, wins!

Name: Attactics
Description:
It’s a race to the center as you try to evade and eliminate your opponents throughout the maze. Move your pieces via various dice sequences and accumulate points to that help advance your Monarch.

Players start at the corner of the board and attempt to be the first to move their Monarch meeple to the center of the board or eliminate the opponent's Monarchs from the game. Players can capture their opponents' pieces to move their Monarch.

Name: Submarine Boost Game
Description:
Submarine Boost Game, a simple roll-and-move game, is a Subway kids meal giveaway.  Each player rolls dice to move three submarines along a track, and the first player to get all their subs to the end wins.  If a submarine lands on an opponent's submarine, the player gets a second turn.

The game comes with punch-out paper pieces and game board that must be assembled.

Name: Game-a-Saurus Rex
Description:
Game-A-Saurus Rex is a playful little prehistoric plush! Rex comes stuffed with a soft blanket that doubles as a playmat along with plenty of pieces that can be used to play 10 different games!

Games include: Rock, Paper, Caveman; Egg Hatch Memory; Tic-Rock-Toe; Speedy Peppers; The Great Egg Race; The Dino Run; Egg Basket; The Rex Connect; Dino Fish; and Do You See What I See?

—description from the publisher

Name: 15 Minute Heist
Description:
The players co-operate to empty a vault of gold before the time is up. The laser locks have to strategically be opened and closed according to dice rolls, so the carts can move between the vaults. The elevator also has to be moved up and down several times to get all the gold out. The same dice control both the locks and the elevator, so the most efficient use of the dice has to be quickly chosen upon.

When in turn, a player always rolls the two colour dice. A die can be used to open or close a matching laser lock on the track, or to move the elevator to the next level, if the colour matches. Further, the player can move their own cart along the tracks on their turn. They try to open a way to an opened vault with gold, and move there to load their cart. With a loaded cart they try to move to the elevator console in the middle of the board, and unload the gold off their cart there. When a cart is being moved, it can move freely along any tracks, until its way is blocked.

A free app needs to be downloaded for full play. The app functions as a timer, but also tells the players when their (non-player) partners on street level have managed to open a new vault. Gold can only be fetched from the opened vaults.

The elevator can only take 3 gold pallets at a time, and 12 pallets need to be brought to street level, before the time is up. If the players manage to bring up the 10th-12th pallets before the time is up, they win! If the 15 minutes are up before that, the players lose...

Name: ギリ、義理チョコ(Giri Giri Chocolate)
Description:
Giri Giri Chocolate is a simple card game. People who got most chocolate will win, but people who got most amount of "Honmei Chocolate" will drop out from the game.

You give present cards to girls of your classmate. You choose a card from your hand and put it on the table, face down. People who shows smallest number start to give it to the girl. They have some restrictions respectively to put your cards.

After you give them gift, you pick up a card from a supply. You continue to doing it 4 times.

When Valentine's Day come, compare your present cards. People who give them most valuable present(biggest number) gains the "Honmei chocolate", and second highest present gains the "Giri Chocolate".

Name: The Brass Age
Description:
The Brass Age is a Steam-and-Ætherpunk, bag and tableau building card battle game. Play as one of several Nations from an alternate 1880, and defeat an enemy nation by recruiting, boosting and activating military forces, manipulating and improving your bag of ability tokens, and researching powerful SCIENCE!

Playable Nations include:

The British Imperium, ruled with an iron fist from the industrial nightmare city of True London by the tyrant Emperor Victor.

The Kingdom of America, led by King Abraham the 1st, who survived an assassin's bullet to drive his people to tame the Weird West.

The Martian Invasion Fleet, hungrily seeking the resources of Earth to save their dying civilization.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rommel's Last Stand: Italy 1943-44, What If?
Description:
"Rommel’s Last Stand: Italy 1943-44, What If?" (RLS) is an low-complexity, two-player wargame simulating the possible events that could have unfolded during the first 30 days of this alternative history World War II campaign.

A complete game generally takes two to three hours to complete, and it is suitable for solitaire play. Each hex on the map equals 5 miles (8 km) from side to opposite side. Each full turn represents two weeks to two months, depending on the time of year. Every ground unit represents a regiment, brigade or division of about 2,500 to 12,000 men and/or 50 to 350 armored fighting vehicles.

published in Banzai Magazine No. 11
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: A.T.R.A.M
Description: A.T.R.A.M (Advanced Reconnaissance and Attack Mission) is one of the first "Computer Aided Board Games". Players command military forces in a simulated NATO exercise against each other.

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Free Worlds League
Description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Free Worlds League introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Federated Suns
Description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Federated Suns introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table. For use with BattleTech, Total Warfare, Tactical Operations, and Strategic Operations.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

Name: AVíO
Description:
AVíO is a trick-taking game in which you must choose wisely which cards to play, and even more which one to keep, in order to win.

The cards in AVíO, as in other trick-taking games, have a value and a suit. The special feature is that they also contain an objective to be fulfilled (an avio). In each round, players are dealt 9 cards and 8 tricks are played. The card that is not played determines the objective of each player in the round and the points he/she gets if he/she fulfills it.

The first player to score 30 points wins the game.

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Draconis Combine
Description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Draconis Combine introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Capellan Confederation
Description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Capellan Confederation introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

Name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Mercenaries
Description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Mercenaries introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

Name: The Middle Ages
Description:
The Middle Ages is a card game for 3-4 players set in Europe during the Middle Ages, with each player taking on the role of a rival ruler, focused on expanding their holdings and weathering the perils of unrest and plague.

The Middle Ages uses a mix of hand management, worker placement, and multi-use cards. The game is driven by the Player Turn cards, which, in combination with the player's unique Accord card, dictate what the player can and must do during their turn.

Each turn, the player must add one card from their hand to a player's Coterie (theirs or another player's - there are benefits and drawbacks to either).  After adding a card to a Coterie, if the player has 3 or more cards in their Coterie, they return all cards in their Coterie and receive a number actions based the cards that were returned. For each Action, a player can play a card to their Structures.

When the deck runs out for the second time, the game ends and players score points for their Accord Icons, Wealth, and Structures.  The player with the most points wins.

Name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 21
Description: The march of technology across BattleTech's eras is relentless, but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic 'Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond). Allowing beloved units redesigned for the BattleTech: Clan Invasion crowd funding campaign to be competitive on "modern"Â battlefields, this series also includes in-universe development notes, battle histories, notable pilots, and record sheets for each 'Mech.

Name: Wiz'N'Bang
Description:
Wiz’N’Bang is a card drafting, dice rolling and tower building game where players take on the role of a grumpy-old wizard attempting to construct the perfect tower on the perfect hill. The only problem; every other wizard trying to do the same.

Players take turns drawing cards, building their tower, playing spells and moving their wizard, all with the intention of building a tower seven cards high and getting their wizard to the top.

Make use of tower cards such as Cannons, Dragons, Portals, and more, to construct your tower one floor at a time in the most offensive or defensive way you please. And use spells such as Fireball, Counter, Deadeye, and more, to defend your tower against the nefarious machinations of your enemies.

Simple in concept but with amazing depth, Wiz’N’Bang brings together open drafting, tower building, dice rolling, meeple management, action distribution and spell casting into a delightfully small package that won’t break the bank or hog the table.

Name: Friends Trivia Game
Description: A trivia game based on the TV series "Friends". The goal of the game is to be the first player or team to get 10 answers correct. Very simple concept with no board or pieces outside of 54 cards.

Name: Zombies, Vampires, and Meteorites
Description:
Zombies, Vampires, and Meteorites is an apocalyptic survival board game, with an engaging balance between luck and strategy. All players start off as Human and explore the board to be the first to survive 12 months of the Apocalypse. However, the Zombie City and Vampire Graveyard is out there and players who discover these locations become those fearsome horrors. And if that’s not enough to make you fret, then have fun dodging the pesky meteorites that continually change the course of the game!

At the start of a player’s turn, they roll the 6-sided Movement Dice and move that many spaces. If they land on an unexplored space, they pull at random a location and build the map. Locations can consist of Elements, Villages, Mountains, Zombie City, or Vampire Graveyard. Then, for a Human player, they decide how to use any collected Elements to work toward Survival Points or decide to attack another player before ending their turn. On a Zombie’s turn, they roll the movement dice, moving 1 less than the number rolled, but can control up to 6 Zombies in a single turn. Their turn ends when all movements and attacks are used.  For the Vampire, they roll the movement dice, moving 1 more than the number rolled, and decide whether to Suck Blood for Energy or Attack a player using Energy to obtain a Coffin. Their turn ends when all movements or attacks are used.

In the scenario a player rolls a SURVIVE! on the Movement Dice, they immediately roll the two Coordinate dice to determine where a Meteorite or Supply Crate lands on the board before concluding that player’s turn automatically.

The Game ends when a Player achieves the requirements to survive the apocalypse. For the Human, it’s collecting 12 months of Supplies (a combination of Elements, Supply Crates, and Defenses). For the Zombie, it’s Replicating in each Human Village and returning all 6 Zombies to the City. And the Vampire must obtain Blood Drops and all 5 Human Coffins before concluding their turn in the Graveyard.

Name: FrogKnight: Ribbit Royale
Description:
A battle has broken out between Frogs, Knights, and all creatures of the Ribbit Kingdom.

Players battle around the board acquiring all different kinds of weapons, ranging from a measly fly-swatter to Bazooka to a swarm of flesh-eating beetles and eliminating other players.  As the playable area shrinks, players are forced in towards the middle until one is left standing as King of the Hill. Champion Royale. Winner, Winner, its Flies for Dinner!

Name: Empire Planners
Description:
This game combines components (25 cards, 27 dice, 27 cubes) from the first 3 Nano9Games - Empire, Railways and City Planner - and has both a solo and two player mode.

Players compete to build and upgrade buildings, create railways, move passengers to their destinations and produce goods in their factories in order to gain Capital and create Profit.

Empire Planners is strictly a rulebook. Players will need Empire, Railways and City Planner to play.

Name: Some Bunny's Hiding
Description:
The Bunnies have hidden in their holes around the game board.

Each player receives three discs and tries to match the colors on their discs to the colors hidden on the bottom of the bunny playing pieces. The first player to find all their bunnies wins! Double-sided game board features two difficulty levels that progress as your child masters memorization and color recognition skills.

Name: Fastrek
Description:
Fastrek is a cooperative game for kids 5 years and above that required teamwork and strategy to win. Play tested and reviewed by teachers, enjoyed by kids and loved by parents. This game can be played by 2 - 4 players.

In Fastrek, players roll their dice to move around the board.  Depending on the spot they land on, players may collect items, encounter monsters, pick an event card or move to another spot on the board.

To win, all players must get to camp before nightfall AND have all the necessary camping items to set up camp.

Name: ワンダーワードワールド (Wonder Word World)
Torch & Blade
Description:
Torch & Blade is a pen and paper, solitaire, dungeon delving game set in a sword and sorcery world. You control intrepid adventurers braving dark and perilous dungeons in an attempt to bring back precious loot and complete arduous quests. The game can be played as a chronicle, an endless chronicle, or a short play campaign. No matter what game mode you choose, you will play several individual sessions, called acts.

During each act you will guide an adventurer through a randomly generated dungeon. The playing time for a single act, once you are familiar with the rules, should be between 60 and 120 minutes.

During a chronicle you will control several characters, alternating among them. At any point you will only have 2 to 4 active characters to pick from, and they will all either succumb or successfully retire and get replaced by new adventurers. A full chronicle can last anywhere between 24 and 192 acts, mostly falling around the middle of those extremes.

A short play campaign lets you complete a full campaign in a shorter time frame. You will control a single character until they either succumb or successfully retire. In this game mode there are no overarching legacy elements, apart from the progress made by your character. A short campaign lasts between 1 and 8 acts.

An endless chronicle lets you keep the legacy element of the standard chronicle, but it doesn't have a fixed end. You can keep creating new characters without end and keep playing until you get bored!

Designed for the 2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

Name: Cultistorm: Face 2 Face
Description:
In Cultistorm Face 2 Face one player takes on the role of the investigator, whereas the other player assumes the role of the cult leader.

The goal of the cult leader is to summon a Great Old One by holding dark rituals using a secret combination of elder signs to call forth and protect 4 cultists, whose job it is to complete the ritual.

The goal of the investigator is to prevent this by defeating the cultists that join the dark ritual each round. The investigator must keep on defeating them until there are not enough (fewer then 4) cultists left to complete the ritual. The investigator must deduce the elder signs connected to each cultist in order to defeat them.

A game consists of several rounds in which the cult leader and the investigator take alternating turns playing their cards.

If there are 4 cultists in play simultaneously, a Great Old One is placed at the end of the row. If the investigator cannot deduce all the remaining face-down ritual cards in his next turn right away (without revealing a card) the dark ritual is complete and the cult leader wins the game.

If the investigator manages to defeat 5 cultists by deducing all the ritual cards allocated to them, the cultists will not have enough power to summon their master and the investigator wins.

Face-2-Face was specifically designed with Essen Spiel ‘19 in mind.

Name: Because Potatoes
Description:
Meet Pata TENSLIP, King POTATO, Pata TAPOIL and Rocky POTATO in crazy adventures! Four types of potatoes have crazy accessories : crowns, boxing gloves, slip ... or nothing ;).

Each player has three cards in hand and one card is placed on the table to start the game. One by one, place a card that has a common point with the last card placed on the table. Win the fold by placing a card on the potato which has something in common with the previous one but nothing in common with the starting potato.
The game ends when the deck is empty. The player with the most of potatoes wins the game !

There is also 5 variants to increase fun and challenge!

Name: Micomicons en el bosque
Description:
What a mess! They have searched all the backpacks and the bag of goodies that you took to eat tonight at the bonfire have disappeared! In its place you have found a strange map with the signature of the "King Micomicon".

If you want to recover your sweets and perhaps find legendary characters and ancient treasures, you will have to enter the magical Forest of the Micomicons. Let the adventure begin!

Our objective will be to cross the magical forest of the Micomicons while we advance through the letters on the way until we reach the King with the objects that he asks us for matching our letters.

Players roll dice to move and pick up cards to deliver to the King.  If they can't deliver to the king, they must move back 1plaec for each card in their hand.

In competitive mode, the first player who manages to reach the king and deliver the objects to him or, failing that, achieve what his roll of the dice indicates, will have won.

If we have played in cooperative mode, when one of the players reaches the king's card and they give him among all the objects he requests or get the action roll with the dice, they will have won.


¡Qué desastre! Han registrado todas las mochilas y la bolsa de chucherías que llevabais para comer esta noche en la hoguera han desaparecido! En su lugar habéis encontrado un extraño mapa con la firma del “Rey Micomicon”. Si queréis recuperar vuestras chuches y tal vez encontrar personajes de leyenda y antiguos tesoros , tendréis que adentraros en el Bosque mágico de los Micomicons. ¡Que comience la aventura! Así se nos presenta este juego que nos trae la editorial Enpeudejocedicions y que ha sido diseñado e ilustrado por Víctor Arenas.Nuestro objetivo será cruzar el bosque mágico de los Micomicons mientras avanzamos por las cartas de camino hasta llegar al Rey con los objetos que nos pide, en nuestras cartas.

El jugador robará una carta del mazo de cartas de objeto y podrá usar una de sus cartas de objeto de la mano dejándola sobre la mesa. Tras ver el resultado, llevará a cabo el efecto final de esa carta, que puede ser avanzar, retroceder o lo que se indique para finalizar su turno y dar paso al siguiente jugador.

En el modo competitivo, el primer jugador que consiga llegar hasta el rey y entregarle los objetos o en su defecto conseguir lo que su tirada de dados indica, habrá ganado.

Si hemos jugado en el modo cooperativo, cuando uno de los jugadores llegue a la carta del rey y le entreguen entre todos los objetos que solicita o consigan la tirada de acción con los dados, habrán ganado.

Name: Giftabell
Description:
A judge draws cards to help inspire a fictional character. One card gives the first letter of the character's name, the other card gives the first letter of a profession, species, or other descriptor.

Then, 2 more cards are drawn. Everyone else thinks of a 2-word ‘gift’, starting with one letter from each card. Whilst people are thinking of gifts, the judge can improvise some details about the person.

Once more than half the people have decided, they all explain their gifts and then the judge picks a winner (the most useful gift for that character), to become the new judge. That player also gets the 4 cards used in the round.

At the end of the game, whoever has the most cards is the winner!

Name: Rainbow Rabbits: Friends Expansion – Frog & Lamb
Description: The Frog and the Lamb join the rabbits in the base game. Increases the player count by two.

Name: The Drunken Idiots Present: A Night Out
Description:
This three part board-style drinking game will take you through the pregame, adventures at the bar, and the drive home. Each section contains their own deck of cards based on real experiences. With up to 6 players A Night Out allows a realistic night out experience with your friends.

During their turn, a player will roll the die, move their game piece, and do what the space says but be careful! If you land on a check point, you could be sent to the drunk tank! The first player to make it to the home space wins!

Although designed with alcohol in mind, this game is compatible with non-alcoholic beverages so anyone can play!

Name: Spielend durch das schöne Heimatland!
Description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space A (Arnsberg). The first to reach space E (Volkmarsen) wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Rechtschreiben
Description: In the game there are 144 picture cards , each of which contains a drawn picture on the front and the written term and derivatives of it on the back. In turn, each player takes a picture card and reads the term to the next player. The next player must write it down. If he has written it down correctly, he receives the picture card. The first player to collect 7 picture cards wins the game. Additional spelling exercises are also included.

Name: Bilderquiz
Description:
On 3 large picture boards, objects are depicted that have certain properties (color, shape, number). A rotary wheel is used to randomly select which property (e.g. "yellow") is being searched for. The first person to point to a matching object (e.g. "lemon") wins a point. Whoever has 5 points first wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Saga:  Age of Hannibal
Description:
SAGA - Age of Hannibal is a Saga supplement that covers the three Punic Wars between Rome and Carthage that took place between 264 and 146 BC.
 This Universe includes six factions - some of which include multiple variants - each with its own Battle Board, history, Legendary Units, and special rules.

As well as these factions, you will find an array of mercenaries who can join your warband, as well as a system of Ruses which allow you to personalise your warband by granting specific advantages or chances to deal treacherous low blows to your enemies.

Finally, the supplement ends with Epic Saga, an entirely new way of playing Saga that allows you to play games with warbands of 12 to 18 points on each side. Now you can recreate the greatest battles of antiquity on your table! This game mode includes special rules and a unique method of setting up the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Interplanetary: Supply Drop – Expansion 1
Description:
This first expansion for Interplanetary, titled Supply Drop, simply adds additional components which are added to the base game's pool of these components. Material of the following types is added:


     more directives cards, which increase the variety of the player's goals and thus the number of possible campaign deck configurations
     additional parts, allowing the player to construct new installations with fresh boons and to bestow new abilities to one's spacecraft
     additional outposts, increasing their number from 4 to 6, thus allowing for new tactics in a playthrough

Name: Hide Your Nuts
Description:
Hide Your Nuts is a strategic, yet easy-to-learn card game that is bound to make you laugh. Take turns hiding your nuts until one player prevails! It is a fast-moving, fun, and easily portable game.  Perfect for traveling, a game night with friends, or a hilarious ice breaker for that first time meeting the in-laws.

On their turn, players use cards to hide their nuts or steal nuts from other players, as well as use weapons and the weather to turn the tide in your favor.
 2-3 Player Game: Be the first player to "hide" 15 nuts in your hiding spots
4-6 Player Game: Be the first player to "hide" 10 nuts in your hiding spots

Hide Your Nuts is intended for ages 13+. It is mostly kid friendly in design, but has a lot of adult humor.

Name: The Adventures of Robin Hood: Friar Tuck in Danger
Description:
Have you successfully completed all the previous adventures of Robin Hood?

Four new tasks await Robin Hood and his companions in the expansion The Adventures of Robin Hood: Friar Tuck in Danger. Unknown warriors attack in the West, and old adversaries become bitter enemies once again. Friar Tuck will support the heroes with his special abilities.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Robin Hood

Name: Andor: The Family Fantasy Game – The Danger in the Shadows
Description:
In this expansion to the base game, a dangerous beast, the Shadow Wardrak, is up to mischief in the lands of Andor. Without hesitation you set off on a quest to rid him from the lands once and for all! But before you start this huge task there is still a lot to do.

Throw yourselves into the fight against the Gors, help the residents of Andor and then defeat the evil Shadow Wardrak to save the land of Andor!

Andor: The Family Fantasy Game series features gameplay that is similar to the popular Legends of Andor, but more approachable to younger players, making it a great introduction to the entire Legends of Andor series of games.

—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: CovidParty!
Description:
Strategy card game.
Your goal is to accumulate as many points as possible by keeping the Virulence of the epidemic as low as possible, and through Missions carried out during the game. Draw and play humorous Development Cards to build your own strategy to resist the epidemic!

On their turn, players roll a dice to determine the evolution of the epidemic, then draw cards, and choose which cards to play to develop their country in accordance with their strategy. It is the intensity of the epidemic in a player's country that determines how many resources he/she will have to play cards during this turn.

Players try to accumulate points by developing certain abilities through playing cards. These abilities can help them slow the epidemic and reduce its intensity, or carry out missions. Both make the player gain points at the end of the game.

A game lasts 6 months, one month in the game being represented by a turn played by all players (so each player plays 6 turns). The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Name: Kyojuu in the Dark
Description:
Kyojuu in the Dark is a strategic memory game about uniting a mythical island under your clan. Four clans make up the island: Rock, Water, Forest, and Earth.

In the darkness, quiet battles rage, with Lords, Warriors, Farmers, and even Children playing their part. Loyal as dogs, the towering Kyojuu fight alongside human masters. These mythical creatures protect their clans with unmatched strength. Remembering former times of peace, the Kyojuu are powerless in the presence of Children.

To start the game, each player places their 9 pieces face down within their designated 3x3 home area. Once placed onto the board, these pieces cannot be flipped over again except when attacking, being attacked, or by the special use of an action card. Each turn, players decide whether to roll and advance their pieces, battle another player, “pinch”, or instead play an action card. When attacking, players reveal the face of one of their pieces that is next to an opposing player's piece. The opponent then reveals their face, and the lower-ranked piece gets removed from the board. The only way to oust a Kyojuu from the board is to “pinch”, which is when two Children from any clan surround a Kyojuu. This move can be made at any point in the game. Through battles and card play, each player’s ultimate goal is to reach the center square of an opponent’s 3x3 square home territory. The first player that lands on the center square of an opponent’s territory is declared the winner.

Name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Booster Set #5
Description:
Expansion for the Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Starter. 
Contains:
3xd8 Movement Impulse dice
3xd10 Weapon Phase dice
2xd12 Weapon Photon Torpedo dice
2xd12 Weapon Quantum Torpedo dice

Each booster set contains 10 new dice to expand your ship and rulebook with rules for multiplayer battles and explaining new dice effects.

Name: Buffalo Wings: Expansion Rules kit
Description:
The Buffalo Wings Expansion Kit expands coverage of the "Winter War" and "Continuation War" between Finland and the USSR, sometimes independent and then as part of WW2. The title comes from a plane -- the Brewster Buffalo -- which was woefully unsuccessful when used by US and British forces, but which the Finns adapted into a very useful fighter, which they nicknamed the "Sky Pearl." (Yeah, they liked it a lot!)

The original Buffalo Wings issue game is popular because it serves as an 'intro' game to the entire "Fighting Wings" series -- games from J.D. Webster that are among the most popular air battle board games of all time. This expansion kit allows folks who want to get deeper and into more complexity with their games to do so while still using the intro rules found in the base Buffalo Wings game itself.

To that end, we've included more "Aircraft Data Cards" (the handy charts which capture everything that makes one plane different from another), plus the bombers in the expansion game now perform as individual planes (they are rather generic in the base game).

Best of all, the new map and ADC cards are still fully compatible with the entire Fighting Wings series of games!

Name: 秘密のオークションハウス (Secret Auction House)
Description:
ç§˜å¯†ã®ã‚ªãƒ¼ã‚¯ã‚·ãƒ§ãƒ³ãƒã‚¦ã‚¹ (Secret Auction House) is an auction game from Japan with some hidden elements. Players bid simultaneously with money cards in a series of auctions. But matching bids cancel each other (butting) in the manner of What the Heck?. So the auction can be won by a player with a low bid.

All bid cards are discarded, until the player exhausts their hand or spends a special token, to refill their hand. By careful choice, a player can know what cards other players have, and manage their own bids successfully.

Players spend cash when they win bids on auction items. Not running out of money too soon is a challenge.

Further, players have two secret cards of winning conditions they want to meet, such as winning different values or combos of items. For example, winning two pairs of items scores 5 bonus points, or a run of items valued 1-3 to get 3 bonus points.

At the end of the auction rounds, the player with the most points wins.
user summary

Name: Poetry for Neanderthals: More Cards Box 1
Description:
More Cards Box 1 is the first expansion to Poetry for Neanderthals.

Poetry for Neanderthals is a competitive word-guessing game where you can only give clues by speaking in single syllables. So, instead of saying "broccoli," you'd say something like "green thing you eat for live long and have good health." If you mess up and use a big word, such as "vegetable," you get bopped on the head with a NO !Stick and you lose points.

The goal of the game is to score the most points by correctly interpreting words and phrases. The chosen Poet starts off the game with a Poetry Card and tries to get their teammates to say the listed word, using only words with one syllable within a 90-second time limit.

The box contains 500 new double sided cards. That’s 2000 new words and phrases to use with Poetry for Neanderthals.

Name: Showcase
Description:
2 player traditional card game in two phases. In the first phase play 13 tricks to draft a hand of cards for round two. The winner of a trick take a face up display card into their Showcase row, while the loser takes the top card of talon into their hand unseen. Then another display card is dealt. After thirteen tricks, in the second phase, the last thirteen tricks are played out exposed using the previously won cards in each's Showcase row.

There are several unique constraints that guide the flavor and strategy of the game: Phase 1 is played "All trump": a player has to follow suit but if they can't and play another suit that card automatically wins.  Only these ruffed tricks count as points in the first phase. In the second phase, the player with the least points in the first phase gets to choose trump (among any of the four suits, no-trump, or a repeat of the all-trump of the first phase).  All tricks count 1 point in the second phase. The other interesting constraint is that if a player leads a suit that the other player has in their showcase row, the other player must follow suit. Otherwise they may play any card.

Name: FuertoRite
Description:
FuertoRite (ãƒ•ã‚¨ãƒ«ãƒˆãƒªãƒ†) is a trick-taking card game from Japan. The game box shows a sail boat on Lake Ashi, which looks strangely familiar.

In FuertoRite, players follow normal trick-taking rules, but with some changes. Players draw more cards as they play, so ending with more hand cards than when they started.

Further, players draft cards with their neighbors during the game. This mix of drawing, drafting and hand management gives the game a different feel.

Scoring is based on which cards players win, but only the smallest set counts, so players must be careful to balance their winnings.

Name: Jooky Jooky
Description:
Specially designed for families with children ages 6 and up, Jooky Jooky is a game about an intrusive insect that players will delight in chasing through 4 different challenges: labyrinth, search & find, majority and alive.

Each player, armed with a swatter, must take a good look at the challenge card in play and be the first to correctly complete the challenge, either by swatting Jooky with their swatter or by swatting the card. The fastest player wins the card. The first player to collect 10 Cards win the game.

This game, which relies on speed, dexterity and observation skills, can easily be adapted to the age and abilities of its players.

Although Jooky Jooky may seem a bit childish at first glance, don’t be fooled, as both children and adults will have a great time! The whole family will enjoy playing this simple yet lively game.

Name: Zombie Bus: Les touristes
Description:
Tourists do not count as an extra zombie card around the bus.

When they arrive, place 5 Injury tablets on the tourists. Remove one at the end of each turn.

As long as there is at least one patch left on the map, you can save these tourists by assigning them 4 action sides in a single turn. Win the card (place it under your hero).

As soon as there are no more pastilles on the map, tourists turn into zombies. They now count as an additional zombie card around the bus that you can no longer release or damage.

Note: if there is no more cheerleader to release, the tourists must also be released or wait for them to transform for the game to end.


Les touristes ne comptent pas comme une carte zombie supplémentaire autour du bus.A leur arrivée, placez 5 pastilles Blessures sur les touristes. Retirez-en une à la fin de chaque tour.

Tant qu'il reste au-moins une pastille sur la carte, vous pouvez sauvez ces touristes en leur affectant 4 faces actions en un seul tour. Remportez la carte (placez-la sous votre héros).

Dès qu'il n'y a plus de pastille sur la carte, les touristes se transforment en zombies. Ils comptent désormais comme une carte zombie supplémentaire autour du bus que vous ne pouvez plus ni libérer ni blesser.

Note : s'il n'y a plus de cheerleader à libérer, il faut aussi libérer les touristes ou attendre qu'ils se transforment pour que la partie prenne fin.

Name: Alfred the Great: The London Campaign, 885 AD (Volume 5)
Description:
Alfred in this period commenced both the re-structuring of his Army and his Burh building program in earnest.

In 885 a Viking army that had been active in Frankia sailed and attacked Rochester, a pivotal Town/Burh with its confluence of roads and river running thru it. The Vikings of East Anglia, under Alfred’s longtime nemesis Guthrum, now saw an opportunity with their Viking Allies to strike back at their Saxon antagonists.

Lundene had been held as a defensive base by the Vikings since 871AD; by reinforcing the existing walls in the old Roman town they commanded a strategic asset which controlled the Thames River from both trading and military perspectives. If Alfred was to achieve his goal of an Anglo- Saxon England than this would have to rectified.

Kings are of great importance in this series of games. When they are leading the warriors in combat your moral and thereby fighting ability is increased, without them it is weakened. Of course, the loss of a King in battle can also mean the loss of your cause. However, in this era risks must be taken to take and hold the crown. Saddle your horse and grab your sword for the King has called you to war…for God and Wessex!

Each copy of Alfred the Great vol. 5: The London Campaign is composed of the following:

Two 11 by 17 hex map sheets.
Two sheets of 267 (total) single-sided, un-mounted counters.
Two Battle Boards.
Two Supply Tracks.
Nine pages of rules including designer notes and examples of play.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players
Series: Warrior Kings Campaign (High Flying Dice Games)

Name: Caucasus Burning: The Nagorno-Karabahk War, 2020
Description: An operational design by Greg Porter covering the Nagorno-Karabahk War of 2020. You'll command formations of T-90 tanks, BMP-equipped mechanized infantry, drones, cruise missiles, and squadrons of attack aircraft as you simulate the war between Armenia and Azerbaijan, which took place in the fall of 2020. Units represent battalions grouped into brigades. Maneuver and attacks in the game are done via actions played from a deck of cards, and each pass through the deck represents 2 days and nights of fighting. A game of Caucasus Burning: The Nagorno-Karabahk War, 2020 will probably take a little less than 10 passes through the deck, so it will run a little faster than the actual war.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Master Word Pocket Version
Description: This miniature, abbreviated version of Master Word was included as a promo in Game Trade Magazine #249. It contains two word cards and a QR code that links to an online rulebook.

Name: Field of War micro card game
Description:
Field of War is an asymmetric game for 3 players. Quick to setup and play, but deep in strategy and escalating consequences. 2 players will fight over the territory playing command cards, recruiting troops and rolling dice to attack each other.  While a third player will try to farm his fields while dodging bombs in a worker placement and resource management style of game. Wait enough time, and the farm workers will raise against its oppressors.

On a turn, the farm player will use their workers to do an action of one of the available fields. Those actions allow him to gather resources, recruit more workers, build a barricade to peacefully trade with the surrounding troops. The army players however, will pick a command card from his hand to choose actions and march over the fields of the farmers, shoot any enemy rolling dice, recruit more troops or upgrade them.

Both sides will collide and at any time, the farmer player can decide to turn intro a revolutionary and fight the armies back.

The game ends when the farmers gather enough resources to pay for mercenaries. Or when the armies eliminate the opponents or troops arrive at the opponent's command base.

Name: Vadmentők
Description:
Animals need brave rescuers now. Defy a thousand dangers, help free the protected animals, take them back to the savannah and the primeval forest! You will have to deal with evil hunters along the way. You have to cross the Nile, which is teeming with wild hippos. You are flying over the barren Sahara. You can only count on the help of caravans. Who will be the first to bring back and feed all five animals?

Game rules: The object of the game is to return the animals to their habitats, the winner is the first to return five animals. They rescue an animal at the camp site by taking an animal card with them. They roll the dice, choosing their own route to get the water and food that will be right for the animal on the way, and then take it back to its natural habitat. When entering a caravan field, we get help cards, when entering a poaching field, we have to draw obstruction cards - unless we have handcuffs, in which case we can take the poach to the hunter.

Name: Ja Ci pokażę Junior
Description:
Ja ci pokaÅ¼Ä™ JUNIOR is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players. It contains cards with items, animals, emotions and professions.

In a game, one of a team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many words from the cards as possible.

There is way of showing in one side of the card and picture on the other side of the card. One player turns around top card and has to show or tell the word in a special way (i.e. only showing with no words or by using only sounds). If the team guesses they get the card as a point. If nobody can´t guess the word and time is up, next team plays.

When the preprepared deck runs out the team with the most points is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Endangered: Campaign Cards
Description:
The Campaign is a series of up to 5 games of Endangered. Each game must use a different species scenario. Winning a game makes the next game harder, while losing a game makes the next game easier!

Before each game, randomly draw one Campaign card (that hasn't already been used in this Campaign). Each card describes conditions dependent on whether you won or lost the previous game. After reading the condition, select your species Scenario and difficulty, and apply the condition.

Track your wins and losses. If you achieve 3 wins before you suffer 3 losses, your campaign is a success! If you suffer 3 losses first, sadly you have failed in your mission. Good luck!

Name: Ancient Blood: The Order of Vampire Hunters
Description:
Ancient Blood - The Order of Vampire Hunters is a cooperative story-driven game for 1 to 4 players that can be played as solo mode, as standalone games, or as a campaign. Choose a story and begin your journey. Be brave and wise, as every choice you make along your path will impact the game world. The wrong choice could awaken your most hidden fears. Fight side by side with your fellow hunters like never before using combo attacks, get help from locals using your skills, and find all the clues that will lead you to the master of each Vampires' clan, The Elder Lord.

Ancient Blood is a prequel to The Order of Vampire Hunters. It features some game mechanics inspired by the old game, but it is a new game. It is not compatible with the previous one, since Ancient Blood is a story-driven game in which your decisions will influence how the game develops and the end of the story. The new game features exploration, crafting, resource management, and leveling up. This time your decisions will change the story of the game, so be prepared to deal with the consequences of your choices.

Can you defeat the Elder Lords?

Name: Endangered: Celebrity
Description:
The Endangered: Celebrity expansion introduces the power of publicity, getting your message out, and mobilizing the masses. Use podcasters, protests, and influence to tip the scale in your favor.

A new role is available for Endangered. The Celebrity mini-expansion comes with a role board, 14 cards, 3 custom dice, and 2 role powers. Change up your game by substituting a celebrity for a role in the core Endangered game. This expansion is contained in the Kickstarter version of Endangered: New Species but is also available separately.

Name: Escape Game avec Maelys
Description:
Help Maëlys and Lucien to get out of the castle before midnight, by solving the puzzles in each room. Hurry, because the clock is ticking, but keep your eyes peeled for clues! Hours of play ahead to have fun all year round!

For 1 to 4 players. From 7 years old. A superb big game: 1 large castle to assemble, 180 puzzle cards, 9 envelopes, 1 red filter, 1 mirror card, 1 Maëlys and Lucien pawn, 1 magnifying glass, 1 clock, 1 hourglass, 1 notepad.

Name: Elf King Red
Description:
Elf King Red is a fastplay game using the Lucid Eye Engine, set in the Elf realms of the Isles of Eas, previously seen in The Red Book of The Elf King & Troll Wars. Ownership of those two books is not essential as this is a standalone product, but they contain lots of colourful background and setting information which some players may find useful. Elf King Red uses similar sized armies to Savage Core, which is around 7 figures or so, seven being a mystical number for the Elves. The game has been written to provide a playable experience with a low commitment entry point.

This free rulebook provides all the basic rules needed to play and includes stats for all of the Factions, otherwise known as Circles in Elf King Red.

So once again strap on your Faeblade of Starmetal, don your Glamourbound Armour and prepare your magick, for Red War and The Fall of All.

Name: Obscure War
Description:
Obscure War is a tabletop miniature board game in which Warwulf Cabal and Vampyric Cabal fight for the control of Obscure Plane Domains. The game takes place in a contemporary Dark Fantasy universe with a rather spectacular mechanic of Power Cards that interact directly on the Game zone and affect the Characters in game.

You have 3 phases in a Turn : Activation, Power, and Dissolution.

During his/her activation, a Character (miniature) can perform 4 types of Optional actions : Power card Action, movement action, attack action, and control action. Each Cabal activates its Characters one after the other until the activation of all the 8 Characters deployed on the Game zone.

In the Power phase, each Cabal gains 1 Power Point for each Obscure Plane’s Domain it controls.

In the Dissipation phase, all the Power Cards are discarded and placed in the Discard.

To win Obscure War, a Cabal must have the highest Power point score after 3 Turns.

Name: ABC Miam
Description:
OBJECT: to fill up the two monsters you own by drawing the right animals.

Each player is the proud owner of 2 monsters! Greedy but difficult monsters, because they only feed on certain letters contained in the names of animals. To try to feed them, you have to draw a card. You then say the name of the animal shown on it. If this name contains one of the letters the monster likes, the monster can be fed. To be full up, it will need 15 calories, i.e. 15 points shown on the cards... Beware of the “indigestion” cards which can make you lose points. The first player to fill their 2 monsters up wins the game!

+++  2 difficulty levels so players can play at their own pace!

—description from the publisher

Name: Interspace Conference on Earth
Description:
ã‚¦ãƒãƒ¥ãƒ¼ã‚«ã‚¤ã‚® (Uchu Kaigi) is a trick-taking game from Japan, about an "interspace conference on Earth".

The players are trying to be selected as the ambassador for an alien conference on Earth. By providing entertainment for the delegates from seven different worlds, a player tries to curry favour. But if they give too much to one of the aliens, they will be penalised for favouritism. They will lose points, and their rivals may gain.

The game follows normal trick-taking rules, players following the colour lead. The cards shows an alien and the amount of hospitality the player is offering. Winning the trick gets the player the host spot and the cards go to their tableau.

Rounds end when a player exhausts their hand. The game end when somebody reaches enough points or enough rounds are played. The player with the most points wins.

However, the different alien races trigger effects, either when the card is played or scored. For example, a player might be forced out of a round, or lose points for having too many cards of one alien. This means players have to make more choices than simply playing high cards.
user summary

Name: Tech City: City of Cards
Description:
Tech City is a multi-player, semi-cooperative city building game for 1-6 players. The cards are tiles that are modular representing companies. Card game effects become available as the city expands. Service companies require multiple players to cooperate to jointly build. Each round players add companies to Tech City and players individually score points as they build companies based on pattern matching and board state. 

The Tech Deck is a modern deck of cards bringing playing cards into the 21st century. It is a game platform designed to support many different games. Each card in the Tech Deck has unique game effects to create unique game experiences. Also, see Tech Grid Poker. Cards represent companies in Tech City each with special effects that players can use.

Each round, players get to play a card representing a company to build up Tech City. They score points based on matching cards they play and the board state. Players then get to use effects on any card in Tech City to make each game experience unique and fun.

The game ends after 6 rounds of play. The player(s) with the most points wins the game.

Name: Stack the Scoops
Description:
Stack the Scoops is a an award winning ice-cream themed family card game kids and adults can enjoy together! Created to be both fun and educational, Stack the Scoops helps reinforce fundamental math skills while encouraging families to connect through games.

The premise is simple, kids and adults take turns trying to make ice cream sets by collecting a base, scoop, and topping. Different cards are worth different points. At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.

Kids love the easy playability and the fun images while the strategy plays on classic card game concepts making it recognizable and fun for adults.

Name: Pentaquark: Campaign Mode
Description:
You've just been hired as the new director of the CERN laboratory. Can you guide your team through six experiments and earn enough grant money to fund future research?

To celebrate the return of Pentaquark, Mike Mullins has designed a campaign mode for the original game.

It uses all Colliders – Pentaquark: Colliders (Kickstarter edition) and Pentaquark: Colliders (BGotMC edition) – (also included in the PNP if you don’t have them) and will keep you on your toes. As if the main game didn’t already do that.

Name: Balkan Wars: The First Balkan War
Description:
Relive the First Balkan War in this exciting and quick playing game. Having recently lost Libyan and Adriatic territories to the Italians, the Ottoman Empire has shown its weakness. Serbia, Greece, and Bulgaria now see this as their opportunity to expand and claim the Balkans for themselves. Will you maintain the Empire and hold lands held since the 14th century for the Sultan? Or will you take your rightful lands from the sick man of Europe and secure your place on the Balkan peninsula?

Designed to play quickly and easily, The First Balkan War will allow you to easily teach younger audiences, and anyone knew to board gaming, how to play A&A style games. Move and recruit armies, rolls dice, and conquer the map. For those veterans of A&A, you already own all the pieces you need to play! Just buy the rondel packs and any relevant units you want for a more immersive experience. Test your strategies against each other and determine the fate of the future powder-keg of Europe!

Name: Hadrian's Wall: Actor
Description:
6 Promo Cards for Hadrian's Wall + 1 rules card.

6 x Actor (1 per player deck)
Scores for completed performances:
2 = 1VP / 4 = 2VP / 6 = 3VP

New rules:
During Setup, each player adds their new Actor Card into their Draw Pile before shuffling. Rather than drawing 2 Cards each Year, players must now draw 3. They still choose 1 as their Path and 1 as their Prospect. The third, unchosen Card must be placed facedown on top of their Draw Pile, which they will see again in the next Year. In Year 6, the unchosen card can be discarded from the game entirely.

Name: Klix Snap Action Baseball
Description:
As pitcher and batter, you and your opponent try to outmatch each other. Just like the real thing! This is a cat and mouse contest between pitcher and batter. Both pitcher and batter actively choose either a black chip or white chip for each at-bat.  When both have chosen, reveal your choices at the same time.  If the colors match, then the batter is OUT.  If the colors do not match, the batter gets a HIT.  If it is a HIT use the "Snap Action Dice" and reference the chart to see what happened. PLAY BALL!!

The player with the most runs wins.
Families: Series: Klix Pocket Travel Games (Tiger Electronics)

Name: レムレース (Lemures)
Description:
ãƒ¬ãƒ ãƒ¬ãƒ¼ã‚¹ (Lemures) is a horror game from Japan. The game can be played solitaire or as a two player co-operative game. The player is exploring a strange fantastic castle, helping souls trapped, and seeking their own way out.

The publisher says:
Is there a place for the soul to return here? The abyss is changing. You will always be exposed to the threat of unknown beings in the castle. Explore the interior of the old castle while rejecting "they".

Since the inside of the castle changes with each play, different developments will come every time. Co-operative play with two people is also possible.

During your exploration, you may find the souls of those who once lived in the castle. Such a soul is already a light in front of the wind, but if you give it power, it will bloom beautiful flowers. On the contrary, if you take power, it will soon die.

You cannot survive in the castle without strong power. Let's create a new technique from Reason and Instinct. There is some danger in learning the art of Instinct. The ending changes depending on whether you follow Reason or Instinct.

If you have been exploring the castle for a long time, you will be oppressed by karma. Karma is a dangerous being that undermines vitality and soul. Be careful, but be quick to explore. The deeper you go into the castle, the more memories of the past will come back ...
publisher's summary

Name: Family Feud Jumbo Card Game: Platinum Edition
Description:
Survey says ... fun, in a big way! Challenge friends and family to give the top answers to survey questions. 
 --- Description from box

Name: Roll Player: 3 Card Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack adds 3 promo cards to Roll Player and can be used in combination with any of the Roll Player expansions.

Included cards: Cursed Ring, Ring of Charity, and the Cartographer backstory card.


         Note: The Cartographer backstory card is included inside every copy of Cartographers: A Roll Player Tale. These cards may not be purchased individually on the Thunderworks Games website, but Cursed Ring and Ring of Charity are available individually through the Boardgamegeek Store (as of 2023) if you already own the Cartographer card.

Name: Artifact: Expanded Rules
Description: Expanded rules published in Space Gamer #34 (Dec. 1980) add new weapons and equipment as well as bases and a point system for design your own scenarios.

Name: Star Wars: Don't Upset The Wookiee!
Description:
Celebrating some of Chewie's best scenes, this is a fast-paced card game where the Wookiee gets all the glory.

Play a card with an angrier Chewie than the last until he eventually loses it! Complete a set of Wookiees, be the first to lose your cards, or be the last one standing to win after three fun filled rounds!

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Third Edition): Destruction Battletome – Orruk Warclans
Description:
The Orruks are Destruction incarnate. This vicious and primal race of natural-born killers loves nothing more than to wage unending war. Their society is built around conflict, and huge migratory invasions called Waaagh!s erupt from all corners of the Mortal Realms to drown the worlds of Order, Death, and Chaos in a green tide of violence. To face the Orruk Warclans is to face total annihilation, for their numbers are beyond counting, and they live solely for the thrill of bloody combat.

In this book, you'll discover the history of the Orruk Warclans, including their presence across the Mortal Realms and the societies that hold them together. As well as exploring the movements and motives of the orruk race, Battletome: Orruk Warclans also gives you insight into their spiritual connection to Gorkamorka, the primordial god of Destruction. The background information is complemented by a full suite of rules allowing you to field armies of Ironjawz, Bonesplitterz, and Kruleboyz, or to combine all three clans into one colossal Big Waaagh!.

This 136-page hardback book contains:

– A war chest of lore about the Orruk Warclans, their history, and their activities following the return of Kragnos
– Stunning art depicting the Ironjawz, Bonesplitterz, and the new Kruleboyz
– 37 warscrolls and pitched battle profiles for everything from sneaky Hobgrot Slittaz to the Earthquake God himself
– 15 warscroll battalions for Path to Glory narrative campaigns
– Allegiance abilities for every Orruk Warclans subfaction, including battle traits, command traits, and artefacts of power, as well as the Big Waaagh! that combines Ironjawz, Bonesplitterz, and Kruleboyz
– Content for matched play, including 5 grand strategies, 6 battle tactics, and 3 core battalions
– Path to Glory campaign rules for creating an Orruk Warclans warband
– A beautiful miniature showcase and painting guide for getting the most out of your Waaagh!
– Extensive bestiary information for the Orruk Warclans units, including the background of Kragnos, End of Empires

'— Description from the publisher'

Name: Hidden Games Junior: Das verschollene Schwert
Description:
A brazen theft has the citizens of Rome in an uproar. The sword of the gladiator statue "Maximus", which stands for bravery and discipline, has been stolen. Alfredo, the guide and guard of the Colosseum, is suspected of having stolen the sword. He asks you for help and already has an idea how to track down the real culprit. Go to Rome, report to Alfredo and find the landmark of past times - the sword of Maximus.

Players embark on an exciting hunt for the culprit as a team, examining real evidence, analyzing interrogations and checking alibis. Players use tools like their cell phones and blur the line between game and reality.

Translated with www.DeepL.com/Translator (free version)

Name: Stella: Dixit Universe – 5 "Personality" card Promo
Description:
Promo card Given with the game at launch.
all "Name Cards" feature a real or fictional personality.

*Sherlock Holmes / Aretha Franklin
 *Pelé / Mulan
 *Cthulhu / Cleopatra
 *Gandhi / Mona Lisa
 *Walt Disney / Marie Curie

Name: Interplanetary: Unity – Expansion 2
Description:
The second expansion for Interplanetary, titled Unity, enables cooperative gameplay, transforming the base game's solo experience into a two-player one.

The majority of the base game's rules as well as its general gameplay structure remains unchanged.

—description from the designer

Name: Tough Calls: Dystopia – Emergencias y Desafíos
Description:
This expansion for Tough Calls: Dystopia contains 60 new cards: 5 new scenarios, 30 new event cards, 10 emergency cards, 10 challenge cards and 5 faction cards.

Our colony will be confronted with extreme emergencies to which you will have to react quickly. Besides, you will be able to obtain extra votes if you solve the different challenges in the best possible way.

-description from developer

Name: Spirit Fire
Description:
Spirit Fire is a non-linear, open-world board game system in which you explore compelling fantasy realms on an introspective journey of discovery, wonder, and mystery. Your choices matter, because instead of following a story, you ARE the story.

This is a substantive, emotionally-driven experience with aspirations beyond the expected iterations on tactical combat and standard gameplay. To emphasize this vision, there is no combat. Instead, this experience finds conflict, pressure, and suspense in the countless other types of difficult challenges life asks us to overcome, including the tensions we face deep within ourselves. In the world of Spirit Fire, wisdom is your only weapon.

The game’s system has two principal pieces: your character box, and realm boxes. With the first, you create your character, with whom you explore the open-world realm boxes. Across the realms, you tell your story in a campaign of your own creation, exploring where you want, pursuing the quests and ideals of your choosing, in an experience some have compared to an MMORPG (like World of Warcraft), but most agree defies easy classification.

Spirit Fire seeks to provide the greatest single player experience available, inspired by a love of TCGs, MMOs, rogue-lite-like loops, metroidvania map development and discovery, fantasy fiction, and—more than anything—a desire for something truly new and fresh.

You’ll explore a series of open-world maps, uncovering new locations and quests in worlds that evolve based on your discoveries and actions. As your character grows, you will craft your deck and bring it to bear against countless unique challenges in the game’s spiral bound book. Each quest or encounter card introduces variables that create a unique variation of one of the book’s dozens (and dozens) of challenge spreads, which vary wildly in style and function depending on the type of activity you are engaged in. Each challenge or activity you’re attempting (evading a threat, deciphering a lost language, negotiating with telepathic wolves, and so forth) recontextualizes your card play, giving you a constant stream of fresh opportunities for creative response without requiring you to learn a bunch of new mechanics all the time.

With drop-in / drop-out multiplayer (meaning seamless transitions between solo and cooperative play, if you’re a “never solo alone”-er), multiple open-world realms coming at launch (with many more in development), and a plan for a continuous stream of quest packs that can by played in any realm, Spirit Fire is a deeply customizable, on-going experience from the award-winning creators of Vindication and Unsettled.

What will you do, in this dark world, with the flame you carry?

—description from the publisher
Families: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

Name: Alice the Train: The Board Game
Description:
Alice the Train is a light-weight, pick-up and deliver board game that is based on the children's book of the same name. In this game, you play as trains with the mission of picking up animals and dropping them off at the zoo. You will build and manage your train cars based on how many animals each can hold while in the "vores" variant, separating the carnivorous tigers from the herbivores of the game. Collect stars when dropping off animals at the zoo with the winner being the player closest to 15 stars.

—description from the designer

Name: Monopoly: Tex
Description:
Tex Willer is a very popular Italian comic book, started in 1948 and still running. Tex Willer, the main character, is a Texas Ranger. American Natives call him "Aquila della Notte" (Night Eagle).

Now he has his own Monopoly edition, too.

Includes a reprint of the classic story "Vendetta Indiana", by Giovanni Ticci

—user summary

Name: Mask of Shame
Description:
The tower and its monsters stand between your ninja clan's rightful place of rule. You must use every fiber of cunning in this push your luck battle.

Draw seven weapon cards and use them to fight your way to the top. Be careful though, not having the right weapons means a long drop to the foot of the tower.

Weapons are made up of 3 colors (red,blue, and yellow) and 2 types (basic and legendary). The Blue Swords, Red Spears, and Yellow Magic Staffs. The legendary weapons also come with powers.

Each level of the tower has one of 7 different monster types. Discard the matching symbol weapons to advance. Your hand size will continue to shrink as you climb the tower thus making it much harder to have the right weapons.

Other clans are also battling their way to ensure they too are noticed. Play through three rounds of cumulating victory points. The player who is in last in between rounds receives the Mask of Shame - A Legendary Item that makes its holder immune, but at great cost to one's honor.

Will you climb your way into the Halls of Honor or be stained with the Shadows of Shame?

—description from the publisher

Name: The Devil's Level:  Expansion Sets
Description:
This set includes five expansion sets for The Devil's Level card game, totaling 144 cards. The Expansions are:

Not Safe for Work: 36 cards that let you steal from your boss and waste time. And you can mess up your customers and other people at work.

Legacy of Boodleheimer: Let's you use Boodleheimer's spirit to control stuff that happens in the game. It gives you cat powers and cat functions.

Sorry I'm Sorry: 36 cards that are about screwing up and breaking stuff all the time. Because it happens to me.

Foil Pack: KS exclusive Foil backed cards.

Admin Pack: KS exclusive pack of ultra-powerful cards designed by the Admin to sneak into your hand during play, unbalance the game, and make your friends mad.

Name: Forty Thieves
Description:
A board game using cards from a traditional deck, Ace through 10 in four suits, and a 6X6 square grid, and colored pieces of two colors. Each square on the grid is labeled with a number representing all combination of products of the card ranks, e.g. 1 (1X1),2 (2X1),3, 4 (2X2, 4X1)..81 (9X9). Two players take turns play a card from their hands into either one of two rows, and then place a piece of their color into the location on the board matching the product of the two cards. For instance if a 3 is the top most card exposed and they play a 7 they could put a piece into square 21.  This continues until a player gets four pieces in a row or the other folds.

—user summary

Name: Puffin Rock: Spin & Find
Description:
Puffin Rock: Spin & Find game was developed to help children strengthen their memory and practice memory techniques. There are two ways of playing it - an easier and a more advanced mode.

The game has a spinner and tiles with characters. The characters are represented on the tiles multiple times in different environments and poses. The goal of the game is to find and get as many tiles as possible.

In the basic game mode, children first mark the back of the tiles. They can draw their unique markings, shapes and doodles that will help them remember what is on the other side. The tiles are then placed face-down. In the second part of the game they spin the spinner and find the character that the arrow points to among the face-down tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game wins.

In the advanced game mode, extra tiles are added, with only some tiles marked, and additional rules apply that make the game even more challenging.

The rules include additional variants for a single player and cooperative gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: A.T.R.: Ahora Todos Reímos
Description:
A.T.R.: Ahora Todos Reímos is a lighter version of H.D.P.: Hasta Donde Puedas.

Play begins with a judge a.k.a. A.T.R. playing a black card with a question or fill-in-the-blank phrase from the top of the deck and showing it to all players. Each player holds a hand of ten white answer cards at the beginning of each round, and passes a card to the A.T.R., face-down, representing their answer to the question on the card. The A.T.R. determines which answer card is the funniest one in the context of the question or fill-in-the-blank card. The player who submitted the chosen card is given the question card to represent a point, and then the player to the left of the A.T.R. becomes the new A.T.R. for the next round. Play continues until a player collects 5 points.
